storyInfo: Grace has realized—this case of refugee aid is a very complicated one. The nobles are unconcerned, the rescue just isn't coming, and with her alone supporting this refugee group, how long can they, and she, hold out?

attributes.text: Eulogy—
I've been going with this two-hundred-odd Leithanien refugee group for...
I can't even tell how many days it's been.
At Leithania's border region, Catastrophe brought about an earthquake, which in turn caused the river to breach its levee.
These poor people lost their home, sought shelter somewhere higher on instinct, and fled all the way here.
The winter days are looming, and many are ill. We're stuck in place.
We have only temporary shelters cobbled together with wood, open to the elements, until help comes for us.
We're currently in Victoria's northwest, near the mountains of Kjerag, far removed from any cities.
As cold weather approaches, our food is running bare. No clothing that can keep us warm, and all medicine has been used up.
Eulogy... this operation turned out nothing like I thought. How could it be so arduous, so tough... Where are the humanitarians, the philanthropic barons...
Dad...
We're still trying, but... so many of us are slowly dying... I'm stood in all this passing away, and I can't see the light.

attributes.content: Victorian northwest border region, somewhere in the forests
(I can't shake this feeling someone's been tailing me the whole time.)
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: (Heheh, don't look away now!)
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Ah! These are the footprints of—!
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: An omnivorous beast! The teeth are in fairly shabby shape. But its claws are sharp; chances are, it tears its prey to slivers before it eats.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: It shouldn't ordinarily attack people, but supposing food runs low in winter... they might just start picking off human stragglers...
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Aaaah!
Ah, wh-whah, wha-wha-aaaaaah—!
Grace—!!!
Buh, bah, whaaaah, don't leave me all alone!!!
So it was you, Rita. Get over here, quickly.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Grace, Grace!! There was rustling in those bushes over there!! It's a beast! Is this where we're going to die?
attributes.name: Rita

attributes.content: Hahaha! Don't lose your head, I made all that up on the spot.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: I was just curious who was creeping around behind me, and here you are.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Mmph!
attributes.name: Rita

attributes.content: Come on, Grace, don't scare me like that!
attributes.name: Rita

attributes.content: Well, I might've made up the beasts, but people who secretly follow you are plenty dangerous too.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Now, confess. Why are you tracking me?
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: I—I was hungry.
attributes.name: Rita

attributes.content: You were hungry, so you followed me looking for food? I don't know, you seem pretty chipper to me, don't you?
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Mama and Papa don't have anything to eat. They gave their last bit of food to me...
attributes.name: Rita

attributes.content: How about the harvest group's food?
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Mama got ill forever ago. After Papa got hurt hunting, the harvest group all said our family doesn't work for anything, and they don't want to give us food...
attributes.name: Rita

attributes.content: And they said, it's winter now, and they can barely find any food like this. There's not enough stores in camp, and unless it gets warmer, we'll be more and more short on food.
attributes.name: Rita

attributes.content: (That's true enough. The situation's continued to deteriorate.)
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: (If help still doesn't show up, then when the time comes...)
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: And... even if I went with them, I don't have any contribution to make to the hunt. They just won't share anything with me. So the last few days, I haven't gone with them...
attributes.name: Rita

attributes.content: Is that how they're going to be now?!
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: *whimper*... Both Mama and Papa are sleeping on sickbeds, and it's cold, and I can't eat enough to not be hungry. I don't feel good.
attributes.name: Rita

attributes.content: Grace, can you help tell me which things are edible? I want to pick some stuff before I go back...
attributes.name: Rita

attributes.content: Even just some weeds would be okay. It doesn't matter how bad it tastes, either. As long as I can feel fuller, it's fine!
attributes.name: Rita

attributes.content: No problem, leave it to me! But just eating weeds you find on the wayside won't do it. If you really want to be full, you'll want beast meat too.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: The food you ultimately get from scrabbling around here won't be enough in the long-term, versus the effort you spend.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: But I—I can't catch beasts.
attributes.name: Rita

attributes.content: Mmm... leave that for today, then. Emergencies first. Tomorrow, I'll take you up north, and we'll see if we can't catch a few little beasties for ourselves!
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Really? Thank you, Grace!
attributes.name: Rita

attributes.content: This is great! Mama and Papa can eat properly too!
attributes.name: Rita

attributes.content: Save your thanks just for now. In exchange, listen to what I say today, and don't go scarpering off, got it?
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Got it!
attributes.name: Rita

attributes.content: Oh, careful where you're stepping! Don't you trip over.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Hehe...
attributes.name: Rita

attributes.content: Are we looking for herbs we can eat now? Mama and Papa are waiting for me to bring back food!
attributes.name: Rita

attributes.content: Ah, this one looks like a herb! Grace, is this one edible?
attributes.name: Rita

attributes.content: Hm... it might look very much like you could eat it, but it's actually poisonous.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Um, then what about this one here?
attributes.name: Rita

attributes.content: Not that one either. It's too tough to chew, and you'll make your mouth bleed.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Then this one! It's a fruit! It's fresh, too. Is this one okay?
attributes.name: Rita

attributes.content: This is a cysteye. A berry that looks just like a cystybeast's eye, right?
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: But it's not edible. It looks plenty delicious, and it's sweet if you try it too. But, afterwards, it'll give you tremendous tummy problems, and the more you eat, the worse it'll get.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Some Victorian nobles use them as weight-loss drugs, run themselves dry eating them, then their lowered immunity leads to all sorts of illness... no matter if it fills you, it's awful for the human body.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Giving other species the runs to spread its own seeds. Evolution truly goes in funny ways, sometimes.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: *whimper*—What do we do then?! We can't find anything to eat at all.
attributes.name: Rita

attributes.content: Don't lose heart. The fruit might not be edible, but you can eat its leaves. They're a little bitter, but won't do any damage to the body. Boiling them will help take some of the edge off.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Then I'll pick just a few leaves to try.
attributes.name: Rita

attributes.content: Heheh, I'll say your luck's not too bad! Look at what I'm holding—you can go find a few of these too.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Are those pebbles?
attributes.name: Rita

attributes.content: Look on top of them. These are wild mossoats—these spores here look just like oats, that's why. You can eat these.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: The books said some of Ursus's farming peasantry in the Northern Tundra grow these, but I never imagined we'd find some here too.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: That's superb! I'll go pick some too!
attributes.name: Rita

attributes.content: The more, the better. Pull off the husks, wash them, and you can boil them for a thin porridge.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: But if we pick them all now, won't there be no more left later?
attributes.name: Rita

attributes.content: The mossoat harvest cycle goes by in a flash. After the harvest period, its sugar content gets absorbed, the spores on top are formed, the 'oat' part of it withers some, and it turns bitter and inedible.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Then are these ones right now good mossoats?
attributes.name: Rita

attributes.content: They are! You've got sound luck, Rita! But these are wild ones after all—they won't be plenty. You'll want to pick all of these to have enough for a full pot.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: I'll go for it, then!
attributes.name: Rita

attributes.content: Incredible stuff, Rita. I'll help you out too.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Thank you, Grace! Hehe, I'm gonna pick loads, and then I'll hide them all, and only give them to Mama and Papa!
attributes.name: Rita

attributes.content: Once I pick all the mossoats, I'll come pick the medicine herbs with you, Grace!
attributes.name: Rita

attributes.content: Perfect. You look around this flat area, then, and don't go too far. I'll see what's westwards. If anything happens, just shout for me!
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Mm-hm! I got it, Grace!
attributes.name: Rita

attributes.content: (It's raining...)
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: (Brrr. The stones are starting to get slippery, too.)
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: (About time I go back and check on Rita.)
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Ritaaaaa—!!
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Iiii'm—oooo—veeer—heeeere—
attributes.name: Rita

attributes.content: (Why is she so far away?)
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Rita?? Where are you??
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Iiii'm—dooown—heeeere—
attributes.name: Rita

attributes.content: Huh?!
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Iiiii—wasn't—caaareful—and—Iiiii—sliiipped—dooown—heeeree—
attributes.name: Rita

attributes.content: Are you hurt?!
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Don't move about! I'll be down in a flash!
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Graaace—beeee—caaaare—
attributes.name: Rita

attributes.content: Aaaaagh—!
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Ah! I wanted to tell you it was really slippery over there, so careful not to step on the stones and fall down here too.
attributes.name: Rita

attributes.content: What does this pit think it is, a slide?!
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Hahaha, there's grass growing from your head now!
attributes.name: Rita

attributes.content: Oh? How about you join in with me? Hupsie-daisy!
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Aha! A moustache!
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Achoo! Ah—ah—achoo! *whimper*... You got all the leafy stuff stuck in my nose, Grace. It's itchy.
attributes.name: Rita

attributes.content: Pff! Watch your snot—you've got snot coming out!
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Nnn...
attributes.name: Rita

attributes.content: Hahahahahahahahahahaha!!
attributes.name: Grace & Rita

attributes.content: Alright, I'm done picking on you. Anyhow, what have you been doing down here?
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: I couldn't find more mossoats up above, so I went to see if there were any underground, so I could pick even more.
attributes.name: Rita

attributes.content: And then I wasn't careful and I fell!
attributes.name: Rita

attributes.content: Are you hurt?
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: I landed on my butt a little hard, but everything else is okay.
attributes.name: Rita

attributes.content: Phew. Thank goodness for that.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Weren't you supposed to be listening to me? I never told you to come anywhere like this, did I?
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: But I only have enough for one pot, and it's not that much. Besides, if we went harvesting tomorrow and it was too late, wouldn't they all be wasted?
attributes.name: Rita

attributes.content: You still have to mind your own safety, though.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Mm-hm... I left my basket up above, so it's alright!
attributes.name: Rita

attributes.content: I saw it just now. Which is why I left my basket there too.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Next to mine?
attributes.name: Rita

attributes.content: Yep, all snuggly.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Hehehe, that's really nice.
attributes.name: Rita

attributes.content: It's raining now. Here, put this on you. Don't catch a cold now.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: This leaf is huge!
attributes.name: Rita

attributes.content: I picked it just before. Wear it on your head, put your horns through these two holes, and that'll block the rain.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: My ears are chilly. I feel a little bad.
attributes.name: Rita

attributes.content: Don't you take it off. The rain'll love to give you a cold if it soaks you. If you get ill too, who's going to care for your mum and dad?
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: That's right, I'm our provider now! I have to make sure Mama and Papa are well-fed!
attributes.name: Rita

attributes.content: Hmm?
attributes.name: Rita

attributes.content: Grace, aren't you gonna put on a leaf?
attributes.name: Rita

attributes.content: You wear yours for now.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: I've actually barely ever gotten rain-soaked. Feels a little unlike anything else.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: How come—how come you never got wet in the rain before?
attributes.name: Rita

attributes.content: Maybe Victoria doesn't get that much rain, actually?
attributes.name: Rita

attributes.content: Rain's a very common sight in Victoria, to be clear, but it's true—I've never been able to shower in it.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Especially like now. Nothing between me and the final rains of autumn, pattering on my head...
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Then I'm even stronger than you are! When it's raining, I fetch laundry outside all the time, and do farm work.
attributes.name: Rita

attributes.content: Rain is pretty much like when the village headman got mad at me. He went, Rita, pbphth, whatbth is phthe meaning of thisph thbphruckus—!
attributes.name: Rita

attributes.content: Hahahaha! Oh, that headman. Just like a spit sprinkler when worked up.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: But he can't sprinkle anymore now...
attributes.name: Rita

attributes.content: He'd just gotten too old. Too tired, too.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: I saw it. That day I secretly followed you, and saw you carrying him out on your back, and you were really struggling to take him so far away, and then soon after you put him down, he just...
attributes.name: Rita

attributes.content: Just floated away like ash, like when we burn wood...
attributes.name: Rita

attributes.content: Will my Mama and Papa become like that too?
attributes.name: Rita

attributes.content: It's been two weeks already since the distress team left. Given they're following my map, they should've found a nearby town by now.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Besides, I've picked so much medicine today, and you've picked plenty of food too. Your mum and dad will be just fine!
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Right! I've worked really hard! Mama and Papa are gonna be better for sure!
attributes.name: Rita

attributes.content: By the way, Grace, why don't you let anyone else help you pick medicine?
attributes.name: Rita

attributes.content: Mm... you know, everyone's in the same boat as your family. They can't eat their fill now, so securing food is more or less top priority for them all.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: That's why nobody has a hand to lend, see.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: The rain's getting stronger, it looks like. Your mum and dad will be worried about you. Head on back first, okay? I can find the rest of the herbs we need by myself.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Mm-hm! I need to bring back everything I picked. I bet Mama and Papa are just as hungry.
attributes.name: Rita

attributes.content: Can you still tell the way back?
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Of course I can!
attributes.name: Rita

attributes.content: Then I'll lift you up out of here. Careful, now.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Hnph!
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: I'm out!
attributes.name: Rita

attributes.content: Grace, grab my hand now, I'll pull you up!
attributes.name: Rita

attributes.content: Hahaha, I'm miles heavier than you are! I can climb out by myself! Don't worry about me, hurry back and check in on your mum and dad!
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Alright~
attributes.name: Rita

attributes.content: Don't run too fast! Watch your step!
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Alriiight—
attributes.name: Rita

attributes.content: Hm... and now we worry about what I'm doing.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: I just saw the herbs I needed on the cliff over there.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: The rain's not going to make this tunnel hard for me, but am I still going to make it up that cliff?
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Yowch, I must've gashed that ankle when I fell down. The wound's fairly big. Need something to stop the bleeding first.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: But I'm not going to win at any gymnastics once I'm bound up. That makes the cliff even harder.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: *hiss*! God, my ankle hurts... I'm feeling a little dizzy too. Have I gotten fatigued lately?
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Rita's mum's in terrible shape. Her dad's suffered external wounds, and I gave first-aid treatment, but it's still at risk of infection.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: The nobles couldn't have possibly missed refugees entering their estate, so why are they so unconcerned... not even just to deport them... why haven't they shown up?
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: The refugees long since ran out of pharmaceuticals, and now all they have is plant remedies for simple treatment. I need to pick more. I need to be able to help more!
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: I hope to heaven we can last until the distress team comes back with someone. I hope to heaven...
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Ah, I can't get bogged down in this. If I let the rain get any worse, that cliff'll only be harder! I need to hurry and pick what I need! I'll bandage myself after I'm back down!
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Victorian northwest border region, refugee camp
Fever medicine for the Hanses. This much should do the trick...
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Toothache painkillers for Peter, but the pain is all it kills... these few herbals might not be quite enough.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Bug repellant... ugh, why am I missing something! Hunger must've shook it out of my mind. I'll go back outside to search later... it's already dark now, and the rain's not dying down...
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Huh? Why's someone at the entrance to my room?
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Miss Arizona!
attributes.name: Leithanien Refugee

attributes.content: Miss Arizona!!!!
attributes.name: Leithanien Refugee

attributes.content: I'm coming! I'm right here!
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Miss Arizona, where on Terra were you?! Some—Someone's gotten extremely sick, out of nowhere!
attributes.name: Leithanien Refugee

attributes.content: What?!
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: (It can't be another case like the village headman, can it?)
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Where? Show me to them!
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Here. Right in here.
attributes.name: Leithanien Refugee

attributes.content: This room is...?
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Rita's family's?!
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Rita? Are you doing alright?
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: No reaction... palms severely scalded, contusions on arms, swelling on the back of the head. Nnn... and a slight fever. She was so well before, too.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: When did you find her like this?
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Just now, about twenty minutes ago.
attributes.name: Leithanien Refugee

attributes.content: What did you come to Rita's for?
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Uh...
attributes.name: Leithanien Refugee

attributes.content: Her parents are in the treatment area. It was her all alone here, making dinner for her mother and father. What were you doing here?
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: I... I... She didn't come picking with us today, that's why! So I just came to see if something was wrong!
attributes.name: Leithanien Refugee

attributes.content: Liar! She said the harvest group wouldn't share anything with her! She hasn't gone with them for several days now!
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: If you truly cared about that, you would've come much earlier, not just now!
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Where's the food she picked today? Why isn't it in this room? Did you break in here and steal her food?
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: I'm just trying to help my family survive too! There's not much food anywhere left at all!
attributes.name: Leithanien Refugee

attributes.content: I didn't know... she'd resist so hard... I didn't know... and now she's in this state...
attributes.name: Leithanien Refugee

attributes.content: Victoria's nobles will not overlook us. The distress team we sent should have found a city by now!
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: And even if that's true, my children won't be able to last until then.
attributes.name: Leithanien Refugee

attributes.content: That doesn't call for robbing a young girl of her food! She collected it by her own efforts.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: This scalding on her palms was because out of fear of you stealing it, she directly tried to carry the boiling pot away, right?
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: The contusions on her arms were from you grabbing her, right?
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: The back of her head was you pushing her and knocking her against something, RIGHT?
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: I didn't... mean to hurt her like this...
attributes.name: Leithanien Refugee

attributes.content: Her mother and father are done for! Even if she survives, so what? Before long, she'll just be a... an orphan! Even if everything gets better, she can't live on alone!
attributes.name: Leithanien Refugee

attributes.content: My children and I are still healthy! Surely our whole family surviving carries more weight than her.
attributes.name: Leithanien Refugee

attributes.content: Is that it? You'll weigh their lives...?
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Then how about me? My life? How much weight do you see in me?
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: I've had a little hunch you've all been gawping at me and my Eulogy, whispering about who in the world I could be.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: So be so kind as to tell me, how much weight do you see in this single life of mine?
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: M—Madam! You've treated us, saved us, some of us have guessed you might be a Victorian noble... out of all of us here, you're the most honorable...
attributes.name: Leithanien Refugee

attributes.content: Then shouldn't you be giving your food to me, making my survival easier?
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Because I—for one—haven't eaten well in a very long time!
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: ...That's...
attributes.name: Leithanien Refugee

attributes.content: But you wouldn't be willing to give food to me, would you?
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: You don't follow any logic, or reason, or any just course of action. All you are is selfish.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: I—despise—the selfish, and I'd let alone even the thought of aiding a robber.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: In light of you at the VERY least informing me about this, I'll give you one more chance—
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Return the food, with not one bit missing! If you've eaten it, make up for it! Or else I guarantee, the distress group's caravan will have no place for you in it.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Yes... I understand, madam.
attributes.name: Leithanien Refugee

attributes.content: *sigh*. So I have it in my nature to tell petrifying lies like that too. Whatever, as long as it had a use.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Rita...
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Malnutrition, fever, physical trauma, inflammation.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: I'll give this fever medication to Rita for now, seeing as it's prepared. If I don't have enough, I can pick some more in a bit to give to the patients in the treatment area.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: *whimper*... don't steal my Mama and Papa's porridge...!
attributes.name: Rita

attributes.content: Rita! It's me, Grace. I'm just borrowing your pot for the moment, decocting some herbs for you. No need to be scared.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Take this drink in a moment, and you'll feel a little better.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: My Mama and Papa's... food... got... stolen...
attributes.name: Rita

attributes.content: It's okay, your food will come back. Just trust in me for now, and get some rest.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Mnn...
attributes.name: Rita

attributes.content: Here, I've already blown it cool it for you, Rita. Open your mouth a bit.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: That's great, Rita! There's a little spilling from your mouth. Let me wipe that for you.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: It'll be effective soon. Just sleep here for a bit. I'll go fetch some other medicines for you!
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Zzz... zzz...
attributes.name: Rita

attributes.content: Already asleep? That's some effective medicine. Just wait for me, now, I'll be right back.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: It's pouring buckets now... so dark...
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: I need to move quick! If I'm any later, I won't be able to see it!
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: My foot... ow...
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: I remember the herbs I was looking for were right near here... leaves like arrowheads, fine sawteeth on top. Ah! Is this it?
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: There! All clean. Now to grind into a powder!
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Hmm...
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Why do I start swooning the moment I apply any force...
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Come on, please, just hold on a little more!
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Okay, and these herbals in matching proportion.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Ah, there's not enough firewood!
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Temperature... I need to collect more firewood.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Ohh...
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Rita. Rita. Don't be scared. I'll feed you some medicine now. It might be a tiny bit... hot.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Oh, I think I forgot to pick out the seeds... it might be very bitter, too.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: I've already applied topical medication to you. This is for reducing your fever. Here, drink, and you'll be much better soon.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: I won't let anything happen to you...
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: (Strained gulp)
attributes.name: Rita

attributes.content: Heehee, good girl, Rita!
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: So dizzy... I can't keep... should—I rest for a moment...?
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Rita...
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Rita... Rita... you have to...
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: She was like this when we found her, mumbling the name over and over.
attributes.name: Warm Voice

attributes.content: She's covered in mud, her ankle is injured, and she has minor Oripathy infection symptoms. Was she only recently infected?
attributes.name: Warm Voice

attributes.content: Oripathy infection is only one part of it. The major contributing factors to her fainting were starvation and extreme exhaustion.
attributes.name: Warm Voice

attributes.content: Reports say she's been passed out for several days now. Some refugees say this young woman was protecting them. Without her efforts, hardly this many would have survived.
attributes.name: Warm Voice

attributes.content: The refugees regained capacity for labor after recovering, and were able to request treatment and a place to stay from Sir Gurk of Leithania. He required people to staff and safeguard that bizarre castle of his.
attributes.name: Warm Voice

attributes.content: These people's home was struck by severe Catastrophe. Going back seems unlikely at present, so most refugees have accepted this proposal. They're prepared to undergo treatment at Sir Gurk's, and to wait for now to see if they should return home.
attributes.name: Warm Voice

attributes.content: Only the reasonable grounds of allowing these refugees to return to their home country could convince any related nobles not to interfere.
attributes.name: Warm Voice

attributes.content: About the young girl named Rita. Her mother has already passed on. Fortunately, her handicapped father is still able to work.
attributes.name: Warm Voice

attributes.content: A Catastrophe Messenger in the vicinity mentioned Earthspirit on the Rhodes Island landship is an old acquaintance of Gurk's. I'll write her a letter asking for a favor, to see if this father and daughter can be admitted onto his estate.
attributes.name: Warm Voice

attributes.content: The young Vulpo lady was unorthodox enough to leave deep impressions on people, but plucking herbal medicine and understanding some clinical theory was all she had. No way of suppressing her own Oripathy.
attributes.name: Razor-like Voice

attributes.content: She's too simple about the task of aiding refugees. It would've cost her her life sooner or later if she was too reductive about it.
attributes.name: Razor-like Voice

attributes.content: In a moment, I want you to make contact with a nearby Messenger. There's two letters I want to send. One to Rhodes Island, and another to a place in Toron.
attributes.name: Razor-like Voice

attributes.content: I'm compelled to remind you, Victoria has nobles who want those refugees dead here to serve their vie over territory. So as to keep our motive secure, we cannot at this moment openly represent Rhodes Island.
attributes.name: Warm Voice

attributes.text: ...Rhodes Island?

attributes.content: Not to mention you slipped out of a Victorian medical seminar to come here. Your actions must be kept subdued. It'll be best you don't give even more issues the chance to form.
attributes.name: Warm Voice

attributes.content: Oh, I was in an academic seminar, huh. See, these past few days, I was under the impression I'd be participating in some wannabe Durins' wine-tasting.
attributes.name: Razor-like Voice

attributes.content: Heh. To some nobles, philanthropy is a trend, and a trend is as far as it goes. They weighed the pros and cons, and did something anyone could've seen coming from a mile off.
attributes.name: Razor-like Voice

attributes.content: She's too weak. If we don't immediately treat her, further illness will seize hold of her, and we'll see her Oripathy infection accelerate.
attributes.name: Warm Voice

attributes.content: Let her pass off as my assistant and get the best treatment Victoria has to offer.
attributes.name: Razor-like Voice

attributes.content: Yeah, no kidding, we're gonna keep our true identities a secret from her. You happy with that?
attributes.name: Razor-like Voice

attributes.content: Assistant? Why do I suspect you're thinking of having her by your side?
attributes.name: Warm Voice

attributes.content: I'm no nanny. You ever seen me drop in from the Victorian skies on an umbrella?
attributes.name: Razor-like Voice

attributes.content: Once she recovers, I'll contact a specialist place and get her on a course for medical Arts, and I've got other fish to fry in the meanwhile.
attributes.name: Razor-like Voice

attributes.content: If she wants to keep up her innocent little savior business, I'm not gonna write in to complain.
attributes.name: Razor-like Voice

attributes.content: But as a doctor with Oripathy, she's got no choice. She can't keep playing the wild maverick forever. Bottom line, she needs to learn how to protect herself. How her own future spirals out is her business.
attributes.name: Razor-like Voice

attributes.content: Suit yourself. *sigh*. I suppose once Scout's done with his mission, I'll be transferring to his squad anyway. Having a Victorian local by your side to keep an eye on you works out.
attributes.name: Warm Voice

attributes.content: I weep for that Vulpo...
attributes.name: Warm Voice

attributes.content: She's sure as hell a lot more confident than you when she treats people.
attributes.name: Razor-like Voice

attributes.content: Hm. And her prescriptions when treating non-Oripathy patients are particularly effective.
attributes.name: Warm Voice

attributes.content: I think I see what it is.
attributes.name: Warm Voice

attributes.content: Kindness, strength, honesty, a tender age yet already at such standards.
attributes.name: Warm Voice

attributes.content: You want to defend a possibility.
attributes.name: Warm Voice

attributes.content: Yes, I'd... very much like to see how she does too. It's a shame I'll probably be on my way back to Rhodes Island before she wakes up.
attributes.name: Warm Voice

attributes.text: Rhodes Island...?

attributes.content: Brave young Vulpo, do get better soon.
attributes.name: Warm Voice

attributes.content: There's still so many people waiting for you—I'll be waiting too, to see how you grow, what you become.
attributes.name: Warm Voice

attributes.content: But I suppose you probably can't hear me right now... hahah...
attributes.name: Warm Voice

attributes.content: I want to witness your future too, young Vulpo.
attributes.name: Warm Voice

attributes.content: If we've been brought together, if we'll ever meet again in future, maybe at Rhodes Island, maybe in some other place somewhere...
attributes.name: Warm Voice

attributes.text: Rhodes... Island...
Eulogy—
After coming aboard Rhodes Island, I never could find that warm voice again.
Lady Earthspirit and Sir Gurk continued correspondence. Rita is currently... not doing well, per se, but at least she can eat her fill.
And I'm doing... very busily here at Rhodes Island. It's very fulfilling, too. I've been in the company of truly outstanding doctors and scholars, trying some major things without break.
Eulogy... thank you all, for forgiving the scene I made.
I'm sorry. I've...
Caught Oripathy.
I'm stood on this vast world, Oripathy stretching far and wide—
And I hope... there'll come a day of finality, from where I can see the light.
", x=300, y=370, alignment=
